Indicator (English): Maternal mortality ratio (per 100,000 live births)
Official SDG Target (formulation): By 2030, reduce the global maternal mortality ratio to less than 70 per 100,000 live births

Indicator (English): Under-five mortality rate (per 1,000 live births)
Official SDG Target (formulation): By 2030, end preventable deaths of newborns and children under 5 years of age, with all countries aiming to reduce under-5 mortality to at least as low as 25 per 1,000 live births

Indicator (English): Neonatal mortality rate (per 1,000 live births)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Same as above

Indicator (English): New HIV infections (per 1,000 uninfected population)
Official SDG Target (formulation): End the epidemics of AIDS by 2030

Indicator (English): Tuberculosis incidence (per 100,000 population)
Official SDG Target (formulation): End the tuberculosis epidemic by 2030

Indicator (English): Malaria incidence (per 1,000 population at risk)
Official SDG Target (formulation): End the malaria epidemic by 2030

Indicator (English): Hepatitis B incidence (per 100,000 population)
Official SDG Target (formulation): End the hepatitis B epidemic by 2030
Measurable Target (Value): Hepatitis B incidence close to 0 by 2030

Indicator (English): Number of people requiring interventions against neglected tropical diseases (NTDs)
Official SDG Target (formulation): End the epidemics of neglected tropical diseases by 2030

Indicator (English): Mortality rate attributed to cardiovascular disease, cancer, diabetes or chronic respiratory disease (per 100,000 population)
Official SDG Target (formulation): By 2030, reduce by one third premature mortality from non-communicable diseases through prevention and treatment
Measurable Target (Value): 33% reduction in premature mortality rate by 2030

Indicator (English): Suicide mortality rate (per 100,000 population)
Official SDG Target (formulation): By 2030, reduce by one third suicide mortality rate
Measurable Target (Value): 33% reduction in suicide mortality rate by 2030

Indicator (English): Death rate due to road traffic injuries (per 100,000 population)
Official SDG Target (formulation): By 2020, halve the number of global deaths and injuries from road traffic accidents
Measurable Target (Value): 50% reduction in road traffic mortality rate

Indicator (English): Proportion of women of reproductive age (15-49 years) using modern family planning methods (%)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Ensure universal access to sexual and reproductive health-care services by 2030

Indicator (English): Adolescent birth rate (births per 1,000 women ages 15-19)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Reduce adolescent birth rates
Measurable Target (Value): Adolescent birth rate < 25 per 1,000 women ages 15-19

Indicator (English): Coverage of essential health services (%)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Achieve universal health coverage, including financial risk protection

Indicator (English): Proportion of population with large household expenditures on health (%)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Reduce the proportion of people with large health expenditures
Measurable Target (Value): < 10% of population with catastrophic health expenditures

Indicator (English): Age-standardized prevalence of current tobacco use among persons aged 15+ (%)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Strengthen the implementation of the WHO Framework Convention on Tobacco Control

Indicator (English): Proportion of target population covered by all vaccines in national program (%)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Support the research and universal access to vaccines and medicines

Indicator (English): Total net official development assistance to medical research and basic health sectors (current US$)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Increase public financing for health research and essential medicines

Indicator (English): Proportion of health facilities with essential medicines available (%)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Ensure availability and affordability of essential medicines in all health facilities

Indicator (English): Health worker density and distribution (per 10,000 population)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Increase recruitment, development, training and retention of the health workforce

Indicator (English): International Health Regulations (IHR) capacity and health emergency preparedness (%)
Official SDG Target (formulation): Strengthen capacity for early warning, risk reduction and management of national and global health risks
